group.lit: How long do other people spend on this unit?
You will learn to brainstorm, plan essays, choose appropriate styles, write drafts, and review them.
You will learn to structure descriptive essays, match words and senses, choose "precise" words, and link ideas using "signpost" words.
You will learn to structure a short report, write topic sentences to introduce a paragraph, mix long and short sentences, and use accurate vocabulary for hotels and restaurants.
You will learn to structure a report, use the present and past in reports, use time prepositions correctly, and describe differences in graphs.
You will learn to structure emails, think about formality in emails, use functional language for asking people to do things, and start emails to people from different cultures
You will learn to lay out an official letter, use formal language in an official letter, write a cover letter for a job application, and choose the correct tense in a cover letter.
You will learn to use layout and abbreviations effectively, identify the important points in a talk, prepare to take notes by researching the topic, and take notes from a talk.
You will learn about typical mistakes in an online profile, the structure of a personal profile, how to check grammar, spelling and punctuation, and how to create a proof reading checklist.
You will learn to be formal and informal in texts, reply in an appropriate style, use common Textspeak vocabulary, and make your texts sound like speech.
You will learn to use other people's words correctly, use verbs to introduce quotations, use the correct tense when reporting others' words, and express other people's ideas in your own words.
